intro: Cnidoscolus megacanthus, commonly known as the giant horse chestnut, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmately compound leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by spiny, fleshy fruits. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its striking foliage.
